sentences.english: It took Cindy a long time to catch on to what Bill was saying.
sentences.chinese: 辛迪許久以後才突然明白比爾所說的話。

sentences.english: He remained a long time thus.
One day she sets off to find her long-lost childhood friend.
sentences.chinese: 某天，她去尋找許久不見的兒時同伴。

sentences.english: He gargles his throat again and then takes a long look at the cavities.
sentences.chinese: 他又嗽嗽喉嚨，盯着空牙洞看了許久。
刀鋒愣怔許久，輕輕點頭。

sentences.english: Long ago in France, people who committed a crime during a full moon were set free.
sentences.chinese: 許久之前的法國，於月圓時分犯罪的人會被釋放。

sentences.english: And the people waited for Zacharias, and marvelled that he tarried so long in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 百姓等候撒迦利亞，詫異他許久在殿裏。

sentences.english: Kong Yiji waited for a while, then said earnestly: “You can’t, can you?
sentences.chinese: 孔乙己等了許久，很懇切的說道，“不能寫罷？

sentences.english: Long after hope has vanished, these phantom-words remain.
sentences.chinese: 希望破滅許久之後，這些詞句“陰魂不散”。

sentences.english: A long time ago somebody told her that her mother was among the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 許久以前，有人跟她講過，她的媽媽就住在那些雲裏。

sentences.english: I hadn t felt that great in a long time.
sentences.chinese: 許久以來，我都沒有過那麼棒的感覺了。

sentences.english: The ship of China-US relations, moored for so long, again set sail, braving the wind and waves.
sentences.chinese: 停航許久的中美關係大船又乘風破浪啓航了。

sentences.english: Too long have I lived among those who hate peace.
sentences.chinese: 我與那恨惡和睦的人，許久同住。

sentences.english: For an absolute age, the street food was monopolized by these little yellow biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 許久許久，街上的喫食仍舊爲小黃餅所壟斷。

sentences.english: For an absolute age, the street food was monopolized by these little yellow biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 許久許久，街上的喫食仍舊爲小黃餅所壟斷。

sentences.english: Warned him abbot thought for a long time, mont forget to beginners mind, he went down the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 方丈思慮許久，告誡他不忘初心，準他下山了。

definition: to become aware/to detect/to realize/to perceive
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
not to see/not to meet/to have disappeared/to be missing
